file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 34-21-01-04 - AHRS COMPUTER - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL AHRS COMPUTER - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedure to remove/install the AHRS computer. B. The AHRS1 computer is located on the left side of the electronic compartment. C. The AHRS2 computer is located on the right side of the electronic compartment. D. The access to AHRS1 and AHRS2 are got through the access panel 113CZ in the forward electronic compartment. E. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 34-21-01-000-801-A AHRS COMPUTER - REMOVAL ALL 34-21-01-400-801-A AHRS COMPUTER - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 34-21-01 Page 1 of 6 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 34-21-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. AHRS COMPUTER - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to remove the AHRS computer. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM TASK 32-00-01-910-801-A/200 LG SAFETY PIN - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 213 113CZ LH Electronic Compartment 214 113CZ RH Electronic Compartment D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Forward Electronic Compartment I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Install landing gear safety pin ( AMM TASK 32-00-01-910-801-A/200). (2) Open the access door 113CZ (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (3) Open the AHRS1 and AHRS2 circuit breakers, on the circuit breaker panel. (4) Attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to AHRS1 and AHRS2 circuit breakers. (5) On the ELECTRICAL panel, on the overhead panel, push the BACKUP pushbutton (stripped bar comes on). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 34-21-01 Page 2 of 6 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Loosen the two self-locking retainers (2) until they disconnect from the support hooks. (2) Remove the AHRS computer (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 34-21-01 Page 3 of 6 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL AHRS Computer - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ZONES 213 214 B DET. A 1. AHRS DET. B 2. SELF-RETAINERS 145AMM340024.MCE A EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 34-21-01 Page 4 of 6 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 34-21-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. AHRS COMPUTER - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to install the AHRS computer. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM TASK 32-00-01-910-801-A/200 LG SAFETY PIN - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL AMM TASK 34-21-00-700-802-A/500 - AMM TASK 34-21-00-700-803-A/500 AHRS - MOUNTING TRAY LEVELING/ALIGNMENT AMM TASK 34-21-00-700-804-A/500 AHRS - MOUNTING TRAY LEVELING/ALIGNMENT C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 213 113CZ LH Electronic Compartment 214 113CZ RH Electronic Compartment D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A CAUTION: WHEN PLACING THE UNIT ON THE MOUNTING TRAY, DO NOT FORCE FIT. IF MATING IS DIFFICULT, REMOVE THE UNIT AND CHECK FOR CONNECTOR PINS THAT MAY BE BENT OR OUT OF ALIGNMENT. ALSO, VISUALLY CHECK THE ALIGNMENT OF THE RECEPTACLE ON THE MOUNTING TRAY. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 34-21-01 Page 5 of 6 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (1) Put the AHRS (1) on the mounting tray. Slide it onto the three guide pins. Slide the unit backwards until its connectors are fully engaged with the mating connectors of the mounting tray. (2) Tighten the self-retainers (2) over the support hooks to secure the unit in place. NOTE: • For aircraft with AHRS AH-800, if the mounting tray is moved in any direction, a complete tray alignment must be done (AMM TASK 34-21-00-700-803-A/500). • For aircraft with AHRS AH-900, if the mounting tray is moved in any direction, a complete tray alignment must be done ( AMM TASK 34-21-00-700-804-A/500). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from the AHRS1 and AHRS2 circuit breakers. (2) Close AHRS1 and AHRS2 circuit breakers. (3) On the ELECTRICAL panel, on the overhead panel, push the BACKUP pushbutton (stripped bar comes off). (4) Do the AHRS Operational Check (AMM TASK 34-21-00-700-802-A/500). (5) Close the access door 113CZ (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (6) Remove the landing gear safety pin ( AMM TASK 32-00-01-910-801-A/200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 34-21-01 Page 6 of 6 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
